data.description: Hereditary was messed up and we loved it! We break down a wonderful performance from Toni Collette and explore some horror tropes along the way.

The Visual Text is looking for guests! Come on and talk about your favorite film, or contribute to one of our upcoming episodes:

Thanks!

data.title: Call Me Mitchy (HI THANKS ERIC YOUDA FREAKIN BEST)
data.author: Eric Revilla, Francesco Pascuzzi, Mitchell Cravens
data.description: Call Me By Your Name is our jam. Oh, and Eric Revilla is a god. I was apparently giving my microphone a blowjob this entire episode and my audio was garbage, and whatdya know Eric provided his magic wand and *POOF* we don't have to redo the episode. So fucking great.
data.long_description:
Call Me By Your Name is our jam. Oh, and Eric Revilla is a god. I was apparently giving my microphone a blowjob this entire episode and my audio was garbage, and whatdya know Eric provided his magic wand and *POOF* we don't have to redo the episode. So fucking great.

data.title: 90th Annual Academy Award Predictions (FINAL)
data.author: Francesco Pascuzzi
data.description:
From the For Your Consideration podcast:

"Ted hosts a final roundtable podcast with most of our previous guests, Cesco, Erik, Topher, Rob and Matt, while we salute Rachel for taking it to the streets for the Women's March.

Join us as we give our final predictions for this year's Oscars. Lots of tight races for the final spot in each category leads to a lot of back and forth. And what the hell is up with Adapted Screenplay? We also leave Best Director for last this time, because we have opinions (all first-time nominees or does Spielberg show up?)."
data.long_description:
From the For Your Speculation podcast:

"Ted hosts a final roundtable podcast with most of our previous guests, Cesco, Erik, Topher, Rob and Matt, while we salute Rachel for taking it to the streets for the Women's March.

Join us as we give our final predictions for this year's Oscars. Lots of tight races for the final spot in each category leads to a lot of back and forth. And what the hell is up with Adapted Screenplay? We also leave Best Director for last this time, because we have opinions (all first-time nominees or does Spielberg show up?)."

For Your Speculation: http://foryourspeculation.libsyn.com/
The Visual Text: https://thevisualtext.com

Enjoy!

data.title: IT is Loooooong Overdue
data.description: We recorded our IT pod fucking forever ago, but the audio got corrupted and I had no idea how to fix it. Hardcore props to Eric Revilla, our guest on this pod, who not only contributed some awesome analysis but also fixed the audio problems. Too bad there's not a life system that gives you cash-value points for kicking ass.
data.long_description:
We recorded our IT pod fucking forever ago, but the audio got corrupted and I had no idea how to fix it. Hardcore props to Eric Revilla, our guest on this pod, who not only contributed some awesome analysis but also fixed the audio problems. Too bad there's not a life system that gives you cash-value points for kicking ass.

https://thevisualtext.com - blog and podcast. check us out.

data.title: My Name is Ladybird
data.description: Ladybird was really good! We discuss its comedic chops, its originality as a genre film, and its (and our) observations on finding common ground with your parents.

data.title: SQL
data.description: Sequels, sequels, sequels! This is from a while back, Mitch forgot to see Kingsman and Jeepers Creepers 3 and Francesco had some things to say about them. Aaaand then Mitch had some stuff to say about other sequels. I am a mess.

data.title: The Comedy Brothers
data.description: A coupla' bros talk about offbeat comedies, namely Little Miss Sunshine and Hot Fuzz. #brosesh
data.long_description:
A coupla' bros talk about offbeat comedies, namely Little Miss Sunshine and Hot Fuzz. #brosesh

If you could subscribe to our podcast and/or rate it, that would be awesome - it's available on iTunes, Google Play, and thevisualtext.com/podcast. We also have a blog at said site, thevisualtext.com, in which Francesco (and soon I) break down even further the films that we discuss on this podcast.

data.title: Hello, Mother!
data.description: OMG, Mother! was weird but kind of amazing. We break down the film and try to give some guidance on how to deal with challenging and/or abstract films in general. YAY FOR INFANTICIDE!
data.long_description:
OMG, Mother! was weird but kind of amazing. We break down the film and try to give some guidance on how to deal with challenging and/or abstract films in general. YAY FOR INFANTICIDE!

data.title: ATOMIC LESBIAN SEX
data.description: OMG THE HOT LESBIAN SEX IN ATOMIC BLONDE WAS SO HOT. (No, not really, and it was kinda problematic...we discuss.)
data.long_description:
OMG THE HOT LESBIAN SEX IN ATOMIC BLONDE WAS SO HOT. (No, not really, and it was kinda problematic...we discuss.) We also get into straight stars playing queer characters and bad films with great scenes.

data.title: A Sofia Coppola-Out
data.description: We discuss the good, the bad, and the ugly of Sofia Coppola's work. We'll take a close look at her latest work, The Beguiled, which is out in theaters now starring Nicole Kidman, and compare it to an earlier film of hers, Lost In Translation. If you could subscribe to our podcast, that would be awesome - it's available on iTunes, Google Play, and thevisualtext.com/podcast. We also have a blog at said site, thevisualtext.com, in which Francesco (and soon I) break down even further the films that we discuss on this podcast.
data.long_description: We discuss the good, the bad, and the ugly of Sofia Coppola's work. We'll take a close look at her latest work, The Beguiled, which is out in theaters now starring Nicole Kidman, and compare it to an earlier film of hers, Lost In Translation. If you could subscribe to our podcast, that would be awesome - it's available on iTunes, Google Play, and http://thevisualtext.com/podcast. We also have a blog at said site, http://blog.thevisualtext.com, in which Francesco (and soon I) break down even further the films that we discuss on this podcast.

data.title: Wonder Woman Comes At Night
data.description:
It's time for.....CHUNKY! In this episode we introduce our wonderful selves and talk a lot about It Comes at Night (2017, Shults) and what it means in today's America. We also tack on a bit about Wonder Woman and what's important about it and what's not. 

Be sure to check out Francesco's review of It Comes At Night at our (but mostly his) film blog @ http://thevisualtext.com. There's one on Wonder Woman too!
